results.title: Je
results.creator_credit: Louis Portugais, Leonard Forest and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: An experiment in modern creative dancing in which a mime of self discovery is expressed in body movements with accompanying sounds. As the movements express awakening, thought and feeling, the sounds change from sounds of nature to marching feet and atomic explosions. Dance: Suzanne Rivest. Camera: Francois Seguillon. Sound arrangement: Maurice Blackburn.

results.title: Irma Vep
results.creator_credit: Olivier Assayas, Georges Benayoun and Dacia Films
results.brief_description: Irma Vep is a charming comedy about the art of filmmaking. When Hong Kong movie star Maggie (Maggie Cheung playing herself) comes to make a film in Paris with French director Rene Vidal(Jean-Pierre Leaud) she has little idea of the maelstrom she is entering. Despite the stresses of being in a strange city with a minimum grasp of the French language, Maggie implicitly believes in her director’s vision. His long-suffering crew, however, do not and when Rene is overcome with the symptoms of a nervous breakdown it seems the film is set for a disasterous outcome. Despite this, “Irma Vep” ends on a magical note as the mysterious director manages to create his vision despite the circumstances of the film-making process. In this fun ‘mockumentary’ Oliver Assayas cryptically comments on the art of filmmaking as well as on the French film industry (and the Hong Kong film phenomenon). Ultimately “Irma Vep” is a vehicle for and a tribute to Hong Kong movie star Maggie Cheung, whose brave performance grounds the whole film. In English and French with English subtitles.

results.title: Introduction to Denmark
results.creator_credit: Danish Government Film Office and Laterna Film
results.brief_description: The basic characteristics and major occupations of the people of a complex modern welfare state. The streets of Copenhagen; its people; the production of food; shipyards launching fishing boats; industries, factory mass production and handcraftsmanship; aspects of culture and recreation, all give revealing insights into this progressive and picturesque country.

results.title: Hello London
results.creator_credit: Sidney Smith, George Fowler and Kinran
results.brief_description: Musical film starring Olympic gold medalist and world famous ice-skater, Sonja Henie, and co-starring Michael Wilding with Stanley Holloway. Light-hearted song and dance film on ice set in London. The cast, including Sonja, all play under their own names.

results.title: Heatwave
results.creator_credit: Phil Noyce, Hilary Linstead, Ross Matthews and Heatwave Films Pty Ltd, Sydney Australia F F P A A
results.brief_description: A suspenseful thriller about a woman who cared too much about people, their lives and their homes, and a man who had a job to do and wouldn’t be swayed by emotions. She represented the people, he represented power and corruption and together they were heading towards trouble. Cast includes Judy Davis, Richard Moir, Chris Haywood, Bill Hunter and John Meillon. PLEASE NOTE: THE 16MM PRINT OF THIS FILM HAS NORWEGIAN SUBTITLES

results.title: Happy together
results.creator_credit: Wong, Block 2 Pictures, Jet Tone Production, Prenom H and Seowoo
results.brief_description: ‘Happy Together’ is a melancholy and bleak reflection on love and loneliness from acclaimed director Wong Kar-Wai. At the film’s centre is the strained romantic relationship between two men from Hong Kong who travel to South America in hope of a reconciliation. Soon enough they break up during an aborted road trip to Iguazu Falls, with both men deciding to stay on in Buenos Aires. Though they each begin separate lives, the couple retains a powerful, if reluctant connection, and when one falls victim to a harsh beating, the couple reunites, though only briefly. The film focuses almost exclusively upon the dance of alienation and togetherness behind this tumultuous relationship, with spectacular cinematography by Christopher Doyle. In Cantonese, Mandarin and Spanish with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Wong, Block 2 Pictures, Jet Tone Production, Prenom H and Seowoo

results.title: Greenkeeping
results.creator_credit: David Caesar, Glenys Rowe and Central Park Films
results.brief_description: One thing after another seems to have gone wrong for the not so bright greenkeeper Lenny (Mark Little). In his professional life he has to contend with brown grass, in his personal life his dope smoking wife (Lisa Hensley) is running up debts with her dealers. He tries to secure the affections of a waitress at the bowling club, but like most other aspects of his life, he lucks out. Things reach a crisis point when Lenny’s lack of greenkeeping skills could result in a loss for the club at the forthcoming Pennant Day. Director David Caesar’s first feature reflects a nostalgia for a simpler time and place.

results.title: Gorillas in the Mist: The Story of Dian Fossey
results.creator_credit: Michael Apted, Arne Glimcher, Terence A. Clegg and Guber-Peters Company
results.brief_description: Based on the true story of anthropologist Dian Fossey who travels to the African mountains to study the rare gorillas. Her interest in the mountain gorillas becomes an obsession and she risks her life to protect them from poachers and animal traders and ultimate extinction. Stars Sigourney Weaver and Bryan Brown.

results.title: Goodbye Sousa
results.creator_credit: Tony Ianzelo, George Pearson and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: The Newmarket Citizens Band, one of Ontario’s best, has been playing the rousing marches of John Philip Sousa for over one hundred years. While other small-town bands may be fading, the Newmarket band is still going strong. To this film’s toe-tapping rhythms you learn the reasons why. (Award: Montreal.)

results.title: Good Will Hunting (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Gus Van Sant, Lawrence Bender and Miramax Films
results.brief_description: Will Hunting (Matt Damon) is a janitor from working-class South Boston, but he is in fact a genius. Abused as a child, he has been in trouble with the law ever since, and is finally facing a jail sentence. In order to save his relationship with his girlfriend (Minnie Driver), and to stay out of jail, Will agrees to receive counselling. With his therapist Sean (Robin Williams), he starts to transform his life. This is the poignant story of both Will and Sean coming to terms with the blows life has dealt them, and the unknown future. Cast includes Ben Affleck, who features as Will’s best friend, and Casey Affleck. (Awards: Academy Awards, Robin Williams for Best Supporting Actor, and Matt Damon/Ben Affleck for Best Screenplay)
